pageContext.claim: “Remember what they did to the young submarine sailor, but did nothing to Crooked Hillary. I ended up pardoning him - It wasn't fair!”
pageContext.analysis: Petty Officer First Class Kristian Saucier pleaded guilty in May 2016 to two felony counts: unlawful retention of national defense information and obstruction of justice, for taking cellphone pictures inside the classified engine room of a Navy nuclear submarine and later destroying his equipment when he learned he was under investigation. Trump pardoned him. The difference here is obvious: Saucier pleaded guilty. Hillary Clinton was investigated by the FBI but not charged with wrongdoing for using a private email server as secretary of state. The Justice Department inspector general found that FBI officials made some errors but acted without political bias.
